key_points: Facebook removed a network of accounts linked to an anti-COVID restrictions movement in Germany.
The action is part of a new crackdown on coordinated campaigns by real users causing harm on and off its platforms.
Facebook's security teams are expanding tactics to shut down harmful coordinated groups of real-user accounts.
The move targets campaigns of "coordinated social harm" by real users systematically violating policies.
Significance for handling organized political and social movements on Facebook's platforms highlighted.
Debate on how platforms should enforce against offline activities linked to online behavior.
The Querdenken movement accused of using accounts to spread harmful health misinformation and incite violence.
Querdenken linked to off-platform physical violence and COVID-related social harms.
Facebook not banning all Querdenken content but blocked its domains and took down fewer than 150 accounts.
The move underlines Facebook's ongoing efforts to combat misinformation and harmful content related to COVID-19.
spokespersons: Nathaniel Gleicher (Head of Security Policy, Facebook)
